title: Campbell Graham
text:
Campbell Graham (born 2 June 1999) is an Australian professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a er and <a href="Centre%20%28rugby%20league%29">centre</a> for the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a>.
He has played at representative level for the <a href="Prime%20Minister%27s%20XIII">Prime Minister's XIII</a>.
Background.
Graham was born in <a href="Sydney">Sydney</a>, <a href="New%20South%20Wales">New South Wales</a>, to British-born parents; his father is from <a href="Glasgow">Glasgow</a>, while his mother is from <a href="Coventry">Coventry</a>.
He played his junior rugby league for the <a href="Coogee%20Randwick%20Wombats">Coogee Wombats</a> and <a href="Maroubra%20Lions">Maroubra Lions</a>, before being signed by the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a>. He completed his <a href="Higher%20School%20Certificate%20%28New%20South%20Wales%29">Higher School Certificate</a> at <a href="Marcellin%20College%20Randwick">Marcellin College Randwick</a> in 2017.
Playing career.
Early career.
In 2016 and 2017, Graham played for the South Sydney Rabbitohs' <a href="National%20Youth%20Competition%20%28rugby%20league%29">NYC</a> team. Late in 2016, he played for the <a href="Australian%20Schoolboys%20rugby%20league%20team">Australian Schoolboys</a>.
2017.
In February, Graham re-signed with South Sydney on a contract until the end of 2019. In round 22 of the <a href="2017%20NRL%20season">2017 NRL season</a>, he made his <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a> debut for South Sydney against <a href="St.%20George%20Illawarra%20Dragons">St. George Illawarra</a>. He wasn't named in the original 21-man squad that NRL teams are required to pick a game day 17-man squad from, but was allowed to play after Souths sought and were granted an exemption by the NRL to include him after a late injury to <a href="Robert%20Jennings%20%28rugby%20league%29">Robert Jennings</a>.
Graham was named in <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Scotland</a>'s squad for the <a href="2017%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">2017 World Cup</a> at the end of the season, but withdrew in order to get a full off-season of training.
2018.
Graham spent the first few weeks of the <a href="2018%20NRL%20season">2018 NRL season</a> playing for South Sydney's feeder side <a href="North%20Sydney%20Bears">North Sydney</a> in the <a href="Intrust%20Super%20Premiership%20NSW">Intrust Super Premiership NSW</a>. In round 9 of the <a href="2018%20NRL%20season">2018 season</a>, Graham scored his first NRL try in South Sydney's 36-18 win over the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a> at <a href="Newcastle%20International%20Sports%20Centre">McDonald Jones Stadium</a>.
Graham made a total of 16 appearances for Souths in 2018 scoring 7 tries as Souths reached the preliminary final against arch rival <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Eastern Suburbs</a> but lost the match 12-4 with Graham playing on the wing.
2019.
In round 3 of the <a href="2019%20NRL%20season">2019 NRL season</a>, Graham scored 2 tries as Souths defeated the Gold Coast 28-20 at <a href="ANZ%20Stadium">ANZ Stadium</a>. In round 19 against St. George, Graham scored a try after the siren had sounded as Souths won the match 20-16 after being down 16-14 with a minute remaining.
In round 21 Graham scored a <a href="hat-trick">hat-trick</a> in a 26-16 loss to <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne Storm</a> at <a href="Central%20Coast%20Stadium">Central Coast Stadium</a>. He was selected at number 4 in Freddy's Team of the Week following his try scoring effort.
Graham made a total of 27 appearances and scored 14 tries for Souths in the <a href="2019%20NRL%20season">2019 NRL season</a> as the club reached their second consecutive preliminary final in a row. Graham scored a try in the preliminary final against the <a href="Canberra%20Raiders">Canberra Raiders</a> but ultimately it wasn't enough as Canberra won the game 16-10.
On 7 October, Graham was selected on the wing for the U23 Australian team.
2020.
In round 15 of the <a href="2020%20NRL%20season">2020 NRL season</a>, Graham scored two tries in a 56-16 victory over Manly-Warringah at <a href="ANZ%20Stadium">ANZ Stadium</a>.
The following week, Graham scored two tries in a 38-0 victory over Parramatta at <a href="Bankwest%20Stadium">Bankwest Stadium</a>.
In round 18 against <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a>, Graham scored two tries in a 26-24 victory at <a href="Bankwest%20Stadium">Bankwest Stadium</a>.
Graham played a total of 21 games scoring 13 tries. He played in two of South Sydney's three finals games. He missed the club's preliminary final loss to Penrith through injury.
2021.
In round 8 of the <a href="2021%20NRL%20season">2021 NRL season</a> against Canberra, Graham fractured his hand in South Sydney's victory. He was later ruled out for four weeks.
In round 15 of the <a href="2021%20NRL%20season">2021 NRL season</a>, Graham scored two tries for South Sydney in a 46-0 victory over Brisbane.
The following week, he scored two tries for Souths in a 38-22 victory over <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a> at an empty <a href="Leichhardt%20Oval">Leichhardt Oval</a>.
In round 25, Graham scored two tries for South Sydney in a 20-16 victory over <a href="St.%20George%20Illawarra">St. George Illawarra</a>.
Graham played a total of 21 games for South Sydney in the <a href="2021%20NRL%20season">2021 NRL season</a> including the club's <a href="2021%20NRL%20Grand%20Final">2021 NRL Grand Final</a> defeat against <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Penrith</a>.
